source language text: So firstly, thinking just about precognition, as it turns out, just last year a researcher called Daryl Bem conducted a piece of research where he found evidence of precognitive powers in undergraduate students, and this was published in a peer-reviewed academic journal and most of the people who read this just said, "Okay, well, fair enough, but I think that's a fluke, that's a freak, because I know that if I did a study where I found no evidence that undergraduate students had precognitive powers, it probably wouldn't get published in a journal.
target language text: Pirmkārt, domājot tikai par pareģošanu, izrādās, ka pērn pētnieks vārdā Derils Bems veica pētījumu, kurā guva pierādījumus universitātes studentu pareģošanas spējām, un tas tika publicēts zinātniski recenzētā akadēmiskajā žurnālā, lielākā daļa cilvēku, kas to izlasīja, teica: „Labi, nu, pieņemsim, ka tā notika, taču, manuprāt, tā ir sakritība, anomālija, jo es zinu, ja es veiktu pētījumu, kurā neatrastu pierādījumus tam, ka universitātes studentiem piemīt pareģošanas spējas, to droši vien nepublicētu nevienā žurnālā.”

label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: My main message is: if we can redefine apathy, not as some kind of internal syndrome, but as a complex web of cultural barriers that reinforces disengagement, and if we can clearly define, clearly identify what those obstacles are, and then if we can work together collectively to dismantle those obstacles, then anything is possible.
target language text: Mans galvenais vēstījums ir, ja varam mainīt apātijas definīciju, nevis kā iekšējo sindromu, bet kā sarežģītu kulturālu barjeru tīklu, kas veicina neiesaistīšanos, ja ar skaidru definīciju varam atpazīt šādus kavēkļus, un ja varam sadarboties, lai šos šķēršļus likvidētu, tad iespējams ir it viss. Paldies.

source language text: Also at the millennium scale, we can look at the way of life of early civilizations such as the ones described in the Bible. And Moses said unto them, 'Have you saved all the women alive? Now, therefore, kill every male among the little ones and kill every woman that hath known man by lying with him, but all the women children that have not know a man by lying with him keep alive for yourselves.'" In other words, kill the men; kill the children; if you see any virgins, then you can keep them alive so that you can rape them.

source language text: The Bergen Railway had its 100-year anniversary that year It goes from western Norway to eastern Norway, and it takes exactly the same time as it did 40 years ago, over seven hours. target language text: Bergenas dzelzceļam togad bija 100 gadu jubileja. Tas iet no Rietumnorvēģijas uz Austrumnorvēģiju un dara to tikpat ilgi kā pirms 40 gadiem — vairāk nekā septiņas stundas. (Smiekli) Tā nu mēs Oslo noķērām programmu redaktorus un teicām: „Mēs gribam veidot dokumentālo filmu par Bergenas dzelzceļu, un mēs gribam to veidot pilnā garumā.” Viņi atbildēja: „Jā, bet cik gara būs programma?”

source language text: BR: And we're chefs. So when Moto opened in 2004, people didn't really know what to expect. A lot of people thought that it was a Japanese restaurant, and maybe it was the name, maybe it was the logo, which was like a Japanese character, but anyway, we had all these requests for Japanese food, which is really not what we did. And after about the ten thousandth request for a maki roll, we decided to give the people what they wanted. So this picture is an example of printed food, and this was the first foray into what we like to call flavor transformation. So this is all the ingredients, all the flavor of, you know, a standard maki roll, printed onto a little piece of paper.
target language text: B.R. : Mēs esam šefpavāri. Kad 2004. gadā atvērām „Moto“, cilvēki īsti nezināja, ko sagaidīt. Daudzi domāja, ka tas ir japāņu restorāns, varbūt pie vainas bija nosaukums, varbūt logo, kas izskatījās kā japāņu hieroglifs, taču, lai vai kā, cilvēki mums sāka pasūtīt visvisādus japāņu ēdienus, kas nebija gluži tas, ar ko nodarbojāmies. Pēc simtu pirmā „maki“ rullīša pasūtījuma mēs nolēmām sniegt cilvēkiem to, ko tie vēlējās. Lūk, attēls ar izdrukāta ēdiena piemēru. Tā bija pirmā ielaušanās mūsu tā sauktajā garšas pārveidošanā. Lūk, visas sastāvdaļas, visas garšas nokrāsas standarta „maki“ rullītim, kas uzdrukāts uz mazas papīra lapiņas.

source language text: If we're going to change children's relationship to food, it's delicious, nutritious food in the cafeterias, hands-on experience -- you're looking in cooking and gardening classes -- and academic curriculum to tie it all together.

source language text: Imagine what you'll tell your children when they ask you, "So, in 2012, Mom and Dad, what was it like when you'd had the hottest decade on record for the third decade in a row, when every scientific body in the world was saying you've got a major problem, when the oceans were acidifying, when oil and food prices were spiking, when they were rioting in the streets of London and occupying Wall Street?

label: ēdiena/ēdiens/ēdienu

source language text: Which is a fantastic story, unless you think about humanity's footprint on the planet, and our ability to keep up food production.

source language text: But at the same time, anthropologists know that most hunter-gatherer tribes of the world, with that very little technology, actually did not spend a very long time gathering the food they needed: three to six hours a day.

source language text: I've been writing about food more or less omnivorously -- one might say indiscriminately -- for about 30 years.

source language text: Their children were hungry and sick, but they didn't ask for food or medicine.

source language text: And so, if we were to dump any of us on Mars right this minute, even given ample food, water, air and a suit, we are likely to experience very unpleasant health problems from the amount of ionizing radiation that bombards the surface of planets like Mars that have little or nonexistent atmosphere.

source language text: Recently, researchers from Penn State University have started looking at the pesticide residue in the loads of pollen that bees carry home as food, and they've found that every batch of pollen that a honeybee collects has at least six detectable pesticides in it, and this includes every class of insecticides, herbicides, fungicides, and even inert and unlabeled ingredients that are part of the pesticide formulation that can be more toxic than the active ingredient.
target language text: Nesen pētnieki no Pensilvānijas Štata universitātes ir sākuši pētīt pesticīdu paliekas putekšņu kravās, ko bites nes mājās kā ēdienu. Viņi atklāja, ka katrā putekšņu partijā, ko medus bites ievāc, ir vismaz seši nosakāmie pesticīdi, tostarp pa katrai insekticīdu, herbicīdu un fungicīdu klasei, un pat inertas un neapzīmētas sastāvdaļas, kas ir pesticīdu formulējuma sastāvā, kas var būt daudz indīgākas nekā pašas aktīvās sastāvdaļas.

source language text: And as evidence that things can actually change, you can now find organic food in supermarkets, and even in fast-food outlets.

source language text: from medical research, space exploration, where I work, at CERN in Geneva, particle physics, engineering, even arts and humanities, funded from the science budget, which is that 3.3 billion, that little, tiny yellow blob around the orange blob at the top left of the screen.

source language text: First of all, most of them were born in the 80s and 90s, under the one-child policy.
target language text: Pirmkārt, vairums no viņiem ir dzimuši 80. un 90. gados, viena bērna politikas ietvaros.
label: vairums

source language text: Don't most science-savvy people know that the theory that vaccines cause autism is B.S.?
target language text: Vai tad vairums to, kas kaut ko sajēdz no zinātnes, nezina, ka teorija par vakcīnu izraisīto autismu ir pilnīgas blēņas?
label: vairums

source language text: So I come to the computer and I start looking on, and suddenly I see many people talking to me, most of them I don't know, and a few of them from Iran, which is -- What?
target language text: Tā nu es piesēdos pie datora un sāku skatīties un ieraugu, ka daudzi cilvēki man raksta. Lielāko daļu no viņiem es nepazīstu un daži no tiem ir no Irānas, kas man lika domāt — ko?
label: daļa/daļu

source language text: And so the bizarre result of this is that most of our popular culture is actually based on these presumptions about our demographics.
target language text: Un šī savādais iznākums ir tāds, ka lielākā daļa no mūsu populārās kultūras ir balstīta uz šiem pieņēmumiem par mūsu demogrāfiju.
label: daļa/daļu

source language text: Most of that brand's litter were their own hot sauce packets, and most of those hot sauce packets hadn't even been opened.
target language text: Vairums šī zīmola atkritumu bija asās mērces paciņas, un vairums no tām pat nebija atvērtas.
label: vairums

source language text: If you are like most people, death might be one of your greatest fears.
target language text: Ja esat kā vairums cilvēku, nāve varētu būt viena no jūsu lielākajām bailēm.
label: vairums

source language text: Every time I am home I am confronted with the usual sources of irritation for most Nigerians: our failed infrastructure, our failed government, but also by the incredible resilience of people who thrive despite the government, rather than because of it.
target language text: Ikreiz, atbraucot mājās, es sastopos ar to, kas kaitina lielāko daļu nigēriešu, – nefunkcionējošo infrastruktūru, nefunkcionējošo valdību, – bet arī ar cilvēku neticamo izturību, kuri zeļ par spīti šai valdībai, nevis pateicoties tai.
label: daļa/daļu

source language text: Well, most of you anyway.
target language text: Nu, vismaz lielāko daļu no jums.
label: daļa/daļu

source language text: But in the majority of the world, where most people in the world live, most countries, girls today go to school as long as boys, more or less.
target language text: Taču lielākajā daļā pasaules, kur dzīvo vairums cilvēku, lielākajā daļā valstu meitenes mūsdienās iet skolā vairāk vai mazāk tikpat ilgi cik zēni.
label: vairums

source language text: That undergirds most of our parenting and managing styles, the way that we motivate our behavior.
target language text: Tas sasaistās ar lielāko daļu vecāku audzināšanas vai vadīšanas stiliem, kā mēs veicinām mūsu uzvedību. Un šī ir problēma, kas ir zinātniski nepareiza divu iemeslu dēļ.
label: daļa/daļu

source language text: Now, most researchers believe obesity is the cause of insulin resistance.
target language text: Lielākā daļa zinātnieku uzskata, ka aptaukošanās ir insulīna pretestības cēlonis.
label: daļa/daļu

source language text: These are the market shares -- most people wanted the combo deal.
target language text: Lūk tirgus sadalījums. Vairums cilvēku izvēlējās kombinēto variantu
label: vairums

source language text: Now this is the major change that I've seen -- how teaching English has morphed from being a mutually beneficial practice to becoming a massive international business that it is today.
target language text: Lielākās pārmaiņas, ko esmu pieredzējusi, ir tas, kā angļu valodas mācīšana ir pārtapusi no abpusēji izdevīgas prakses milzīgā starptautiskā biznesā, kāds tas ir pašlaik.
label: pašlaik

source language text: But when it comes down to me, right now, to all the beliefs I hold, here in the present tense, suddenly all of this abstract appreciation of fallibility goes out the window -- and I can't actually think of anything I'm wrong about.
target language text: Taču, kad runa ir par mani pašlaik, par visu, kam es ticu šeit un tagad, pēkšņi visa abstraktā izpratne par kļūdīšanos izkūp kā dūmi gaisā -- un es nevaru iedomāties, kur kļūdos.
label: pašlaik

source language text: We're now working on trying to tile the brain with recording elements, too, so we can record information and then drive information back in -- sort of computing what the brain needs in order to augment its information processing.
target language text: Mēs pašlaik strādājam pie kāda darba, kurā mēs cenšamies izvietot smadzenēs datu ierakstīšanas elementus. Tā mēs varam ierakstīt informāciju un tad to ievietot atpakaļ -- sava veida izskaitļošana, ko smadzenēm vajag, lai pieaugtu tās informācijas apstrāde.
label: pašlaik

source language text: The future holds the promise that new drugs will be developed that are not symptom-modifying drugs that simply mask the problem, as we have now, but that will be disease-modifying drugs that will actually go right to the root of the problem and attack those glial cells, or those pernicious proteins that the glial cells elaborate, that spill over and cause this central nervous system wind-up, or plasticity, that so is capable of distorting and amplifying the sensory experience that we call pain.
target language text: Nākotnē solās attīstīsies jaunas zāles, kuras nav simptomus pārveidojošas, kas vienkārši nomaskē problēmu, kā tas ir pašlaik, bet tādas, kas būs slimību pārveidojošas zāles, kas aizkļūs līdz problēmas saknei un uzbruks šīm glijas šūnām vai šīm kaitīgajām olbaltumvielām, kurus glijas šūnas izstrādā, kas izplatās un izraisa centrālās nervu sistēmas bojājumu vai plastiskumu, kura tad ir spējīga izkropļot un pastiprināt sajūtu pieredzi, ko mēs saucam par sāpēm.
label: pašlaik

source language text: It took quite many years for the program to become what it is now.
target language text: Tas prasīja programmai diezgan daudzus gadus, lai tā kļūtu tāda, kāda tā ir pašlaik.
label: pašlaik

source language text: Now you have billions of this machine right now working away inside you, copying your DNA with exquisite fidelity.
target language text: Jums ir miljardiem šādu mašīnu, kas pašlaik jūsos strādā, kas kopē DNS ar ārkārtīgu precizitāti. Tas ir precīzs atspoguļojums,
label: pašlaik

source language text: And again, you have billions of cells undergoing this process right now inside of you.
target language text: Vēlreiz atgādinu, ka jums ir miljardiem šūnu, ar kurām šis process pašlaik jūsos noris.
label: pašlaik

source language text: So together they form a map for the rest of the brain, telling the brain continually, "Where am I now within my environment?"
target language text: Kopā tie veido karti pārējām smadzenēm, nepārtraukti sakot smadzenēm: „Kur es pašlaik atrodos?”
label: pašlaik

source language text: And I started watching Kaki King a lot, and she would always cite Preston Reed as a big influence, so then I started watching his videos, and it's very surreal right now to be -- (Laughter) (Applause) CA: Was that piece just now, that was one of his songs that you learned, or how did that happen?
target language text: Es daudz sāku skatīties Kaki Kingu, un viņa vienmēr kā lielu savas iedvesmas avotu minēja Prestonu Rīdu, tā nu es sāku skatīties viņa video, un pašlaik ir ļoti sirreāli atrasties... (Smiekli) (Aplausi) K.A. : Dzirdētais skaņdarbs, vai tā bija viena no viņa dziesmām, ko iemācījies vai kā tas notika?

source language text: In fact, there have been so many studies conducted on publication bias now, over a hundred, that they've been collected in a systematic review, published in 2010, that took every single study on publication bias that they could find.
target language text: Pašlaik ir veikti vairāk nekā 100 pētījumu par publikāciju subjektivitāti, un tādēļ tie ir apkopoti sistemātiskā vērtējumā, kas publicēts 2010. gadā un kurā tika ņemts vērā katrs pētījums par publikāciju subjektivitāti, ko viņi varēja atrast.
label: pašlaik

source language text: So now we're funding them to the tune of about five or six million dollars to collaborate and bringing them together, and that's a unique thing in the cancer world, and we know, through that collaboration, it will accelerate outcomes.
target language text: Tātad, pašlaik šī komanda saņem ap pieciem vai sešiem miljoniem dolāru, lai viņi sanāktu un strādātu kopā, un tas ir kas nebijis vēža pētniecības pasaulē, un mēs zinām, ka šī sadarbība paātrinās mērķa sasniegšanu.
label: pašlaik

source language text: Which means that we are now in a position where we have reduced traffic across this toll cordon with 20 percent, and reduced congestion by enormous numbers, and people aren't even aware that they have changed, and they honestly believe that they have liked this all along.
target language text: Kas nozīmē, ka mēs pašlaik esam situācijā, kur mums, pateicoties šiem nodevas stabiem, satiksme ir samazinājusies par 20 procentiem, un sastrēgumi samazinājušies pat ļoti pamatīgi, un cilvēki pat neapzinās, ka viņi paši ir mainījušies, un visā godīgumā uzskata, ka viņiem tas ir paticis jau no paša sākuma.

source language text: At most now, I suppose, we tolerate the need for sleep, and at worst perhaps many of us think of sleep as an illness that needs some sort of a cure.

source language text: With high-speed cameras, we can do the opposite of time lapse.
target language text: Ar zibkamerām mēs spējam paveikt pretējo.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: It can hover, fly backwards, even upside down.
target language text: Tā spēj turēties uz vietas gaisā, lidot atpakaļgaitā un pat ar galvu uz leju.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: This guy can make himself look like a rock, and, looking at his environment, can actually slide across the bottom, using the waves and the shadows so he can't be seen.
target language text: Paskat, šis te čalītis spēj izlikties par akmeni un, vērojot apkārtni, ar viļņu un ēnu palīdzību nemanāmi slīdēt pa okeāna dibenu.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: But we have something that plays the same role, with much more elegance though: the trees, our good old friends that, like geysers, can transfer an enormous amount of water from the ground into the atmosphere.
target language text: Taču mums ir kas tāds, kas dara to pašu, tikai daudz elegantāk — mūsu draugi un labdari — koki, kas tāpat kā geizeri, spēj transportēt milzīgu daudzumu ūdens no augsnes augšup atmosfērā.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: I mean, who can remember what they said a year ago?
target language text: Kurš gan spēj atcerēties, kas pateikts pirms gada?
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: There is one simple act of transgression that can rob a couple of their relationship, their happiness and their very identity: an affair.
target language text: Ir viens vienkāršs pārkāpums, kas spēj laupīt pārim viņu attiecības, viņu laimi un pat viņu identitāti – tā ir mīlas dēka.

source language text: So OK, so a reporter said to me, "Maybe, but how do you really know that other animals can think and feel?"

label: spēj/spējam

source language text: Like starlight, which can convey images of the way the Universe looked in the distant past, so multispectral light can take us back to the first stuttering moments of an object's creation.
target language text: Tāpat kā zvaigžņu gaisma mums spēj pastāstīt, kā Visums izskatījies tālā pagātnē, multispektrālā gaisma spēj aizvest mūs līdz pirmajiem objekta radīšanas mirkļiem.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: Like starlight, which can convey images of the way the Universe looked in the distant past, so multispectral light can take us back to the first stuttering moments of an object's creation.

label: spēj/spējam

source language text: And at least for LIGO, the frequencies that it can hear are in the audio band.
target language text: Un vismaz priekš LIGO... frekvences, ko tā spēj saklausīt, atrodas skaņu frekvences diapazonā.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: Without water, a human can only survive for about 100 hours.
target language text: Cilvēks bez ūdens spēj izdzīvot aptuveni 100 stundas.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: If we can understand how they, and other creatures, stabilize their sensitive biological molecules, perhaps we could apply this knowledge to help us stabilize vaccines, or to develop stress-tolerant crops that can cope with Earth's changing climate.
target language text: Ja sapratīsim, kā tie un citas radības stabilizē savas jūtīgās biomolekulas, varbūt varēsim šīs zināšanas izmantot, lai stabilizētu vakcīnas vai izveidotu noturīgus kultūraugus, kas spēj pretoties klimata pārmaiņām.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: And number three: your voice and your vote can make that happen.
target language text: Un, treškārt, jūsu balss un balsojums to spēj paveikt.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: When we dial this real world to the virtual, we can do magical things.
target language text: Kad mēs pārslēdzamies no īstās uz virtuālo pasauli, mēs spējam veikt brīnumu lietas.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: By borrowing genes for anti-freeze protein from fish and genes for drought tolerance from other plants like rice and then stitching them into the plants that need them, we now have plants that can tolerate most droughts and freezes.
target language text: Aizņemoties antifrīza proteīna gēnus no zivīm un sausumizturības gēnus no tādiem augiem kā rīsiem un tad ievietojot tos augos, kam tie vajadzīgi, mums nu ir augi, kas spēj izturēt sausumu un aukstumu.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: Thousands of years of human evolution has not only given us humans like Tibetans, who can thrive in low-oxygen conditions, but also Argentinians, who can ingest and metabolize arsenic, the chemical element that can kill the average human being.
target language text: Gadu tūkstošiem ilgā cilvēces evolūcija mums ir devusi ne tikai tādus cilvēkus kā tibetiešus, kas spēj dzīvot skābekļa nepietiekamības apstākļos, bet arī argentīniešus, kas spēj uzņemt un pārstrādāt arsēnu, – ķīmisko elementu, kas parasti cilvēku nogalina.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: Thousands of years of human evolution has not only given us humans like Tibetans, who can thrive in low-oxygen conditions, but also Argentinians, who can ingest and metabolize arsenic, the chemical element that can kill the average human being.
target language text: Gadu tūkstošiem ilgā cilvēces evolūcija mums ir devusi ne tikai tādus cilvēkus kā tibetiešus, kas spēj dzīvot skābekļa nepietiekamības apstākļos, bet arī argentīniešus, kas spēj uzņemt un pārstrādāt arsēnu, – ķīmisko elementu, kas parasti cilvēku nogalina.
label: spēj/spējam

target language text: Mēs, pieaugušie viegli spējam viņus atšifrēt.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: So what we thought is, let's strip out all the metadata, let's look at what machine learning can do based purely on visual recognition of this entire collection.
target language text: Tā nu mēs izdomājām aizvākt visus metadatus un paskatīties, ko spēj paveikt mašīnmācīšanās, balstoties tikai un vienīgi uz visas kolekcijas vizuālo atpazīšanu.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: This gives us a unique perspective on what machines can do, what they can't do and what jobs they might automate or threaten.
target language text: Tas sniedz mums unikālu skatījumu uz to, ko mašīnas spēj, ko tās nespēj un kādas darba vietas tās varētu automatizēt un apdraudēt.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: A machine can read millions of essays or see millions of eyes within minutes.
target language text: Mašīna spēj izlasīt miljonus sacerējumu un apskatīt miljonus acu dažu minūšu laikā.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: But there are things we can do that machines can't do.
target language text: Bet ir lietas, ko spējam un mašīnas nespēj.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: How could I make people see not only his autism, but see him the person and everything he can give; everything he can do; the things he likes and doesn't like, just like any one of us?
target language text: Kā panākt, ka cilvēki ierauga ne tikai viņa autismu, bet arī viņu pašu un visu to, ko viņš var dot? Visu to, ko viņš spēj izdarīt? To, kas viņam patīk un kas ne, gluži kā ikvienam no mums?
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: How could I make people see not only his autism, but see him the person and everything he can give; everything he can do; the things he likes and doesn't like, just like any one of us?

label: spēj/spējam

source language text: So now people can say, "I want exactly this and this and this," and you can go out and fold it.
target language text: Cilvēki var teikt: „Es vēlos tādu un tādu figūru,” un mēs spējam tās izveidot un izlocīt.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: Only one section of the tree of life can actually make a feather.
target language text: Patiesībā tikai viena dzīvības koka daļa spēj veidot spalvas.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: So if I hear this as a designer: a colored surface, a glass colored surface, color that's mostly just used for esthetics, now gets an extra function and is able to harvest electricity, I think, where can we apply this, then?
target language text: Tādēļ, ja es kā dizainere dzirdu, ka krāsota virsma, krāsota stikla virsma... ka krāsa, ko parasti izmanto estētiskiem nolūkiem, ir ieguvusi jaunu lomu un spēj uzkrāt elektrību, es domāju, kā mēs to varam izmantot.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: We also can grieve for people we've never met, across space and time.
target language text: Mēs spējam sērot par cilvēkiem, kurus nekad neesam satikuši, no kuriem mūs šķir attālums un laiks.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: But other than letting some of you live out your fantasy of looking as cool as Tom Cruise in "Minority Report," the reason why we're really excited about this device is that it really can act as one of these sixth-sense devices that gives you relevant information about whatever is in front of you.
target language text: Tomēr mēs vēlamies ne vien ļaut jums izdzīvot fantāziju, ka izskatāties tikpat elegants kā Toms Krūzs filmā "Īpašais ziņojums", bet mēs esam patiešām sajūsmā par šo ierīci arī tādēļ, ka tā spēj veikt funkcijas, kas raksturīgas sestās maņas ierīcēm, kas sniedz atbilstošu informāciju par jebko, kas atrodas jums priekšā.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: These wind turbines can rotate in incredibly slow windspeeds, as a result.
target language text: Pateicoties tam, šīs vēja turbīnas spēj rotēt pie ārkārtīgi maziem vēja ātrumiem.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: So one thing I know about music: music is the only thing that has power to enter your cell system, your mind, your heart, influence your soul and your spirit, and can even influence the way you live without even you knowing.
target language text: Es zinu, ka mūzika — tikai mūzika spēj ienākt cilvēka šūnās, cilvēka prātā un sirdī, ietekmēt garu un dvēseli, un pat to, kā cilvēks dzīvo, cilvēkam to pat nemanot.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: I always say that, you know, if you hire people just because they can do a job, they'll work for your money, but if they believe what you believe, they'll work for you with blood and sweat and tears.
target language text: Es vienmēr esmu teicis, ja nolīgstat cilvēkus, kas spēj paveikt darbu, tie strādās naudas dēļ, bet, ja nolīgstat cilvēkus, kas tic tam, kam ticat jūs, tie strādās jūsu labā ar asinīm, sviedriem un asarām.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: Because we can imagine, in essence, continuing on.
target language text: Tāpēc, ka spējam iedomāties būtības turpinājumu.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: Because if left unchecked, these algae can kill coral and take over entire coral reefs, a costly change that is difficult or impossible to reverse.
target language text: Ja aļģēm ļauj savairoties, tās spēj iznīcināt koraļļus un pārņemt veselus rifus – visai dārga pārmaiņa, ko ir grūti vai neiespējami labot.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: "Queerer than we can suppose."
target language text: Dīvaināka, nekā spējam iedomāties.
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: What is it that makes us capable of supposing anything, and does this tell us anything about what we can suppose?
target language text: Kas ir tas, kas mūs padara spējīgus kaut ko iedomāties, un vai tas kaut ko pasaka par to, ko spējam iedomāties?
label: spēj/spējam

source language text: Now these are not election returns, these are the people -- the number of the people who are obese by state, beginning in '85, '86, '87 -- these are from the CDC website -- '88, '89, '90, '91 -- you get a new category -- '92, '93, '94, '95, '96, '97, '98, '99, 2000, 2001 -- it gets worse. We're kind of devolving. (Laughter) Now what can we do about this? Well, you know, the diet that we've found that can reverse heart disease and cancer is an Asian diet.
target language text: Šie nav vēlēšanu rezultāti, tas ir aptaukojušos cilvēku skaits pa štatiem, sākot no 1985. gada, 86., 87. – tie ir Slimību kontroles un novēršanas centra dati, – 88., 89., 90., 91. – parādās jauna kategorija – 92., 93., 94., 95., 96., 97., 98., 99., 2000., 2001. Kļūst aizvien sliktāk. Mēs it kā regresējam. (Smiekli) Kā mēs to varam labot? Mēs konstatējām, ka sirds slimības un vēzi var apturēt Āzijas diēta,
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: Traditionally it's been by how difficult it is to calculate, but now we can reorder it by how difficult it is to understand the concepts, however hard the calculating.
target language text: Parasti, mācību tēmas bija sakārtotas pēc to aprēķinu sarežģītības, taču tagad mēs varam to pārkārtot, pēc matemātisko konceptu sarežģītības, lai cik grūti arī nebūtu aprēķini.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: I can, however, give you at least a taste of what I regard as the most powerful theory of beauty we yet have.

source language text: How can we explain this universality?
target language text: Kā mēs varam izskaidrot šo universālismu?
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: Each of us, with a single step, can take the world, can bring the world a step closer to peace.
target language text: Ikviens no mums, ar vienu rīcību, varam visu pasauli pietuvināt soli tuvāk mieram.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: The things I can tell you about it: It's universal; we all have it.
target language text: Vienu es jums varu pateikt: tā ir universāla sajūta, mums visiem ir tā. Vienīgie cilvēki, kuri nepiedzīvo kaunu,
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: We can also connect with people based on our very specific interests.
target language text: Mēs arī varam savienoties ar cilvēkiem, balstoties uz savām ļoti specifiskajām interesēm.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: We can integrate over the surface, and the notation usually is a capital sigma.
target language text: Mēs varam integrēt pa virsmu, un apzīmējums parasti ir lielā sigma.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: We've got a million people on the site already, so we can handle a few more.
target language text: Mums lapā jau ir miljons cilvēku, mēs varam tik galā ar vēl dažiem. (Smiekli)
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: (Laughter) (Applause) Here, we can get more green energy all over.
target language text: (Aplausi) Mēs visur varam vairāk ražot atjaunīgu enerģiju.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: We are blessed with a language, a system of communication, so powerful and so precise that we can share what we've learned with such precision that it can accumulate in the collective memory.
target language text: Mēs esam svētīti ar valodu, saziņas sistēmu, kas ir tik varena un precīza, ka mēs varam dalīties apgūtajā ar tik lielu precizitāti, ka mēs varam veidot mūsu kopējo atmiņu.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: And that means it can outlast the individuals who learned that information, and it can accumulate from generation to generation.
target language text: Tas nozīmē, ka mēs varam pārdzīvot tos īpatņus, kas apguva šo informāciju, un varam nodot informāciju no paaudzes paaudzei.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: We can democratize our public spaces.
target language text: Varam demokratizēt publisko telpu.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: Augustine understood that our capacity to screw up, it's not some kind of embarrassing defect in the human system, something we can eradicate or overcome.
target language text: Augustīns saprata, ka mūsu spēja visu sačakarēt nav apkaunojošs defekts cilvēka sistēmā, kaut kas, ko varam likvidēt vai pārvarēt.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: A lot of fun, negotiations and stories, I can tell you, with 17 very interesting museums from nine countries.
target language text: Varu jums pastāstīt daudz jautru stāstu un sarunu ar 17 ļoti interesantiem muzejiem no 9 valstīm.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: Instead of one point in the brain, we can devise devices that span the brain, that can deliver light into three-dimensional patterns -- arrays of optical fibers, each coupled to its own independent miniature light source.
target language text: mēs varam izgudrot ierīces, kas aptver visas smadzenes, kuras var nogādāt gaismu trīsdimensionālos modeļos -- optisko šķiedru rindās, kur katra no tām savienota ar neatkarīgu mazu gaismas avotu. Un tad mēs varam mēģināt izdarīt lietas organisma iekšienē,
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: And we didn't like that, so we actually, in maybe a couple of weeks, we built these little enclosures that enclosed the projectors, and so we can leave them on all the time and they're completely silent.
target language text: Mēs ar to nebijām mierā, un tāpēc, kādu pāris nedēļu laikā, mēs uztaisījām šos mazos ietvarus, kas aptver projektorus tā, ka mēs tos varam turēt ieslēgtus visu laiku, un tie ir pilnīgi klusi.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: And as we become more of a global company, we find these things really affect us -- you know, can we work effectively with people who aren't in the room?
target language text: Un tā kā mēs arvien vairāk kļūstam par pasaules mēroga uzņēmumu, mēs jūtam, ka šīs lietas mūs patiešām ietekmē, ziniet, vai mēs varam efektīvi strādāt ar cilvēkiem, kuru nav telpā?
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: Given the computer model, we can test the model by essentially quizzing it.
target language text: Ar šādu datormodeli mēs to varam pārbaudīt uzdodot tam jautājumus.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: And this could be really useful as we try to decipher the script by generating more data that we can analyze.
target language text: Tas varētu būt ļoti noderīgi rakstības atšifrēšanas gaitā, radot vairāk datus, ko varam analizēt.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: We tend to retreat and say, "We can draw a picture, we can post some graphs, we get it, we understand how this works."
target language text: Mēs mēdzam norobežoties un teikt: „Mēs varam uzzīmēt attēlu, mēs varam publicēt grafikus, mēs to saprotam, mēs saprotam, kā tas strādā.”
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: We tend to retreat and say, "We can draw a picture, we can post some graphs, we get it, we understand how this works."
target language text: Mēs mēdzam norobežoties un teikt: „Mēs varam uzzīmēt attēlu, mēs varam publicēt grafikus, mēs to saprotam, mēs saprotam, kā tas strādā.”
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: And, furthermore, when skeletal muscle is injured, that's what causes chemokines -- these signals saying, "Cancer, you can come to me," the "go signs" for the tumors -- it causes them to highly express these chemokines.
target language text: Un turklāt, kad skeleta muskulis ir ievainots, tas ir tas, kas liek kemokīniem -- šiem signāliem teikt: “Vēzi, tu vari nākt pie manis”, dot zaļo signālu audzējiem -- un ievainotajam muskulim šie kemokīni ir stipri izteikti.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: (Noise) So even if you're in a noisy environment like this -- and we all spend a lot of time in places like this -- listen in the coffee bar to how many channels of sound can I hear?
target language text: (Troksnis) Pat ja jūs esat trokšņainā vidē kā šī — mēs tādās vietās pavadām daudz laika — kafijas bārā, ieklausieties, cik daudz skaņu kanālus es varu sadzirdēt?
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: We can then choose, from among a range of options, the best one.
target language text: Tad mēs varam izvēlēties vislabāko no iespējamo izvēļu klāsta.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: We can build on their wisdom.
target language text: Mēs varam veidot savu pieredzi no citu gudrības.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: If I can learn by watching you, I can steal your best ideas, and I can benefit from your efforts, without having to put in the time and energy that you did into developing them.
target language text: Ja es varu mācīties, tevi vērojot, es varu nozagt tavas labākās idejas, un es varu būt ieguvējs no tavām pūlēm, netērējot laiku un enerģiju, darot to, ko darīji tu, lai tās izstrādātu.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: If I can watch which lure you use to catch a fish, or I can watch how you flake your hand axe to make it better, or if I follow you secretly to your mushroom patch, I can benefit from your knowledge and wisdom and skills, and maybe even catch that fish before you do.
target language text: Ja es redzu kādu ēsmu to izmanto, lai ķertu zivis vai es redzu, kā tu asini savu rokas cirvi, lai padarītu to labāku vai arī, ja es tev paslepus sekoju līdz tavai sēņu lasīšanas vietai, es varu būt ieguvējs no tavām zināšanām un gudrības, un prasmes, un varbūt pat noķert šo zivi pirms to izdari tu.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: Once we have language, we can put our ideas together and cooperate to have a prosperity that we couldn't have before we acquired it.
target language text: Tiklīdz mums ir valoda, mēs varam apvienot mūsu idejas un sadarboties labklājības veicināšanai, kas nebūtu iespējams bez valodas.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: And that question is whether in this modern, globalized world we can really afford to have all these different languages.
target language text: Un jautājums ir, vai šajā modernajā, globalizētajā pasaulē mēs tiešām varam atļauties visas šīs dažādās valodas.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: And when we come together and work as one, we can achieve extraordinary things.
target language text: Ja mēs sanākam kopā un darbojamies kā viens vesels, mēs varam sasniegt brīnumainas lietas.
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: I said, "Can I see some evidence for this?"
target language text: Es vaicāju, "Vai es varu redzēt kā tas izskatīsies?"
label: varam/vari/varu

source language text: The positive perspective, I think, of all of this is that, if we do understand when we go wrong, if we understand the deep mechanisms of why we fail and where we fail, we can actually hope to fix things.
target language text: Tā pozitīvā lietā, manuprāt, no visa šī ir tāda, ja mēs saprotam, kad esam kļūdījušies, un ja mēs saprotam šos stipros mehānismus, par to, kāpēc mēs kļūdāmies un kur mēs kļūdāmies, tad mēs varam patiesi cerēt to visu mainīt.

source language text: But the frequency of the light we see is so high, it waves up and down about 400 million million times a second, that we can't possibly see it as a wave. But we can tell, by looking at its color, what its frequency is.
target language text: Taču mums redzamās gaismas svārstību biežums ir tik liels, — tā viļņojas augšup un lejup aptuveni 400 miljonu miljonu reižu sekundē — ka mēs nekādi nespējam to saskatīt kā vilni. Bet, redzot tā krāsu, mēs varam pateikt, kāda ir tā frekvence.

target language text: Var secināt, ka skolotāji un skolēni visā pasaulē šo iespēju jau izmanto.
label: skolēni/skolēniem

source language text: My students, both adults and kids, paint their self-portraits, trying to discover their own unique color.
target language text: Mani skolēni, gan pieaugušie, gan bērni, glezno pašportretus, mēģinot atklāt paši savu neatkārtojamo krāsu.
label: skolēni/skolēniem

source language text: I tell my students, "If you have a deceptive cadence, raise your eyebrows, and everybody will know."
target language text: Es vienmēr saku saviem skolēniem: „Ja jūs izmantojat maldinošo kadenci, vienmēr paceliet uzacis. Tad visi zinās.” (Smiekli)
label: skolēni/skolēniem

source language text: They had good relationships with the teachers, students.
target language text: Viņiem bija labas attiecības ar skolotājiem, citiem skolēniem.
label: skolēni/skolēniem

source language text: Teacher: Perfect! Students: Perfect!
target language text: Skolotājs: Nevainojamā! Skolēni: Nevainojamā!
label: skolēni/skolēniem

source language text: I think if our students, if our high school students -- if all of the American citizens -- knew about probability and statistics, we wouldn't be in the economic mess that we're in today. (Laughter) (Applause) Not only -- thank you -- not only that ...
target language text: Manuprāt, ja mūsu skolēni, ja mūsu vidusskolēni, ja visi ASV pilsoņi, saprastu varbūtību un statistiku, mums nebūtu šāda ekonomiskā ķibele, kādā mēs esam pašlaik. Ne tikai – paldies – ne tikai tāpēc...
label: skolēni/skolēniem

source language text: The students should teach their teachers.
target language text: Skolēniem vajadzētu mācīt savus skolotājus.
label: skolēni/skolēniem

source language text: Students need to decide, "All right, well, does the height matter? Does the side of it matter?
target language text: Skolēniem pašiem jāizdomā, piemēram, vai augstums ir būtisks? Vai lielums ir būtisks?
label: skolēni/skolēniem

source language text: Students are looking at their watches, rolling their eyes, and they're all wondering at some point or another, "Man, how long is it going to take to fill up?"
target language text: Skolēni skatās savos pulksteņos, bola acis, un kaut kādā brīdī viņi visi nodomā: "Ārprāts, cik ilgā laikā tā piepildīsies?"
label: skolēni/skolēniem

source language text: So I'm here to report some really fun games with students who come pre-installed with these viruses day one of the class.
target language text: Tāpēc esmu šeit, lai pastāstītu par dažiem aizraujošiem ieguvumiem darbā ar skolēniem, kuri nāk gatavi ar šīm slimībām pirmajā skolas dienā.
label: skolēni/skolēniem

source language text: And millions and millions of students take these tests every year.
target language text: Miljoniem studentu ik gadu kārto šos eksāmenus.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: My students said that I should really seriously consider getting some protection.
target language text: Mani studenti ieteica man nopietni apsvērt domu pieņemt kāda veida aizsardzību.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: Some of them look like places I lived in as a graduate student.
target language text: Daži no tiem izskatās kā vietas, kur es dzīvoju, kad biju maģistratūras students.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: I was an obsessive compulsive student.
target language text: Es biju obsesīvi kompulsīvs students.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: And in my research and my teaching, I found that these students, no matter how happy they were with their original success of getting into the school, two weeks later their brains were focused, not on the privilege of being there, nor on their philosophy or physics, but on the competition, the workload, the hassles, stresses, complaints.
target language text: Veicot pētījumu un mācot es sapratu, ka šie studenti, neskatoties uz to, cik viņi laimīgi bija sākotnēji iestājoties skolā, divas nedēļas vēlāk viņu smadzenes vairs nedomās par to, kāds gods ir tur atrasties, nedz arī filozofiju vai fiziku. Viņu smadzenes koncentrējās uz konkurenci, mācību slodzi, grūtībām, uztraukumu, sūdzībām. Kad es pirmo reizi ierados, es iegāju pirmkursnieku ēdamzālē
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: One of my students came up after class, an introductory class, and she said, "You know, poetry is harder than writing," which I found both erroneous and profound.
target language text: Reiz pēc lekcijas, ievadlekcijas, pie manis pienāca viens no studentiem un teica: „Ziniet, dzeja ir grūtāka nekā rakstīšana”, kas man vienlaikus šķita nepareizi, bet dziļdomīgi.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: This is that student, David Bradwell, who, in this image, appears to be wondering if this thing will ever work.
target language text: Šis ir tas students, Deivids Bredvels. Izskatās, ka šajā fotogrāfijā, viņš prāto, vai tas jelkad vispār strādās.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: And sometimes afterwards I'll stick around and sign books and take photos with students.
target language text: Un dažreiz pēc tam es vēl palieku un parakstu grāmatas, un fotografējos ar studentiem.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: This is me being inspired by my first tutor, my mom, and this is me teaching Introduction to Artificial Intelligence to 200 students at Stanford University.
target language text: Tas esmu es, iedvesmojoties no mana pirmā pasniedzēja, manas mātes, un te esmu es, pasniedzot ievadu mākslīgajā intelektā 200 studentiem Stenfordas universitātē.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: A student said, "This class felt like sitting in a bar with a really smart friend who's explaining something you haven't grasped, but are about to."
target language text: Students sacīja: „Šajā klasē ir sajūta, kā sēžot bārā kopā ar tiešām gudru draugu, kurš izskaidro kaut ko, ko neesi sapratis, bet tūlīt sapratīsi.”
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: We didn't want students to memorize the formulas; we wanted to change the way they looked at the world.
target language text: Mēs nevēlējāmies, lai studenti mācās no galvas formulas, mēs vēlējāmies mainīt to, kā viņi raugās uz pasauli.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: Of course, we couldn't have a classroom discussion with tens of thousands of students, so we encouraged and nurtured these online forums.
target language text: Protams, mēs nevarējām izveidot klasi, kurā diskutē desmitiem tūkstošu studentu, tāpēc mēs iedrošinājām un uzturējām šādus tiešsaistes forumus.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: It was crucial that the students see that we're working hard for them and they're all supporting each other.
target language text: Ir ļoti svarīgi, lai studenti redzētu, ka mēs viņu dēļ smagi strādājam un viņi visi viens otru atbalsta.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: This, of course, is not true for the students who graduate from the top institutions, but for many others, they do not get the value for their time and their effort.
target language text: Tas, protams, neattiecas uz studentiem, kuri pabeidz pašas labākās augstskolas, taču daudziem citiem rezultāts nav ieguldītā laika un pūļu vērts.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: Some students took their certificate and presented this to an educational institution at which they were enrolled for actual college credit.
target language text: Daži studenti savu sertifikātu iesniedza izglītības institūcijai, kurā mācās, un ieguva īstus kredītpunktus.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: Students can traverse this material in different ways, depending on their background, their skills or their interests.
target language text: Studenti var strādāt ar materiālu dažādos veidos atkarībā no savas pieredzes, prasmēm un interesēm.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: So this format allows us to break away from the one-size-fits-all model of education, and allows students to follow a much more personalized curriculum.
target language text: Tādējādi, pateicoties šim formātam, mēs varam izvairīties no „viens un tas pats der visiem” izglītības modeļa, un studenti var sekot individuālākam mācību plānam.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: Perhaps one of the biggest components of this effort is that we need to have students who practice with the material in order to really understand it.
target language text: Iespējams, viena no svarīgākajām šī projekta sastāvdaļām ir studenti, kas strādā ar materiālu, lai to patiešām izprastu.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: Now, how do you grade the work of 100,000 students if you do not have 10,000 TAs?
target language text: Bet kā izvērtēt 100 000 studentu atbildes, ja nav 10 000 asistentu?
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: What's even more surprising is that self-grades, where the students grade their own work critically -- so long as you incentivize them properly so they can't give themselves a perfect score -- are actually even better correlated with the teacher grades.
target language text: Vēl pārsteidzošāk ir tas, ka pašvērtējums, kad studenti paši kritiski izvērtē savu darbu, — ja vien tiek dota pareizā motivācija, lai viņi neliktu sev vislabāko atzīmi — pat vēl labāk sakrīt ar skolotāju liktajām atzīmēm.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: But this is not just about students sitting alone in their living room working through problems.
target language text: Taču runa nav tikai par studentiem, kas sēž vieni paši savās istabās, risinot uzdevumus.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: Students collaborated in these courses in a variety of different ways.
target language text: Studenti šajos kursos sastrādājas dažādos veidos.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: First of all, there was a question and answer forum, where students would pose questions, and other students would answer those questions.
target language text: Pirmkārt, ir jautājumu un atbilžu forums, kurā studenti uzdod jautājumus un citi studenti uz tiem atbild.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: And the really amazing thing is, because there were so many students, it means that even if a student posed a question at 3 o'clock in the morning, somewhere around the world, there would be somebody who was awake and working on the same problem.
target language text: Un lieliskākais ir tas, ka, tā kā studentu ir tik daudz, pat tad, ja students uzdos jautājumu plkst. 3 no rīta, kaut kur pasaulē būs kāds, kas ir nomodā un risina to pašu uzdevumu.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: The big cross at the top left is where 2,000 students gave the exact same wrong answer.
target language text: Lielais krusts augšējā kreisajā stūrī ir nepareiza atbilde, ko izvēlējās 2000 studentu.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: Imagine if we could teach so that 98 percent of our students would be above average.
target language text: Iedomājieties, ja mēs varētu mācīt tā, ka 98% mūsu studentu būtu virs vidējā līmeņa!
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: But maybe we can afford to provide each student with a computer or a smartphone.
target language text: Taču varbūt mēs varam atļauties nodrošināt katru studentu ar datoru vai viedtālruni.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: And maybe we should spend less time at universities filling our students' minds with content by lecturing at them, and more time igniting their creativity, their imagination and their problem-solving skills by actually talking with them.
target language text: Varbūt universitātēs vajadzētu pavadīt mazāk laika, piepildot studentu prātus ar saturu, lasot viņiem lekcijas, un vairāk laika, iededzinot viņu jaunrades spēju, iztēli un problēmu risināšanas prasmes, patiešām sarunājoties ar viņiem.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: And I get on the car, and I look, and I notice this couple, college-aged, student-looking kids, a guy and a girl, and they're sitting next to each other, and she's got her leg draped over his knee, and they're doing -- they have this little contraption, and they're tying these knots, and they're doing it with one hand, they're doing it left-handed and right-handed very quickly, and then she'll hand the thing to him and he'll do it.
target language text: Es iekāpju vagonā un paskatos apkārt, es ievēroju kādu pāri, universitātes vecuma jauniešus, izskatās pēc studentiem, puisis un meitene, viņi sēž viens otram blakus, viņa ir pārlikusi savu kāju pāri viņa celim un viņi darbojās. Viņiem ir neliels meistarojums, un viņi sien kaut kādus mezglus, viņi sien ar vienu roku, sien ar kreiso roku un ar labo roku, sien ļoti ātri, tad viņa padod to viņam un tad sien viņš.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: So I went to my neighbors and friends and students and I just asked them, give me a picture, I will make you a poster.
target language text: Es devos pie saviem kaimiņiem, draugiem un studentiem un lūdzu, lai viņi man iedod fotogrāfiju un es izveidošu plakātu.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: I teach one of the largest evolutionary biology classes in the US, and when my students finally understand why I call them fish all the time, then I know I'm getting my job done.
target language text: Es pasniedzu vienu no lielākajiem evolucionārās bioloģijas kursiem ASV, un, kad mani studenti beidzot saprot, kāpēc es tos visu laiku saucu par zivīm, es zinu, ka savu darbu esmu paveicis.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: As the medieval knight Antonius Block returns from the wild goose chase of the Crusades and arrives on the rocky shore of Sweden, only to find the specter of death waiting for him, Mr. Teszler sat in the dark with his fellow students. And as death opened his cloak to embrace the knight in a ghastly embrace, I heard Mr. Teszler's tremulous voice: "Uh oh," he said, "This doesn't look so good." (Laughter) But it was music that was his greatest passion, especially opera.
target language text: Viduslaiku bruņiniekam Entonijam Blokam atgriežoties no Krusta Karu savvaļas zosu medībām un ierodoties Zviedrijas akmeņainajā krastā, kur viņu jau gaida nāves rēgs, Teslera kungs sēdēja tumsā starp studentiem. Kad nāve atpleta savu apmetni, lai apņemtu bruņinieku nāvīgos apskāvienos, es izdzirdēju Teslera kunga trīcošo balsi: „Vai, vai,” viņš teica: „Nu gan nav labi.” (Smiekli) Viņa lielākā kaislība bija mūzika, sevišķi opera,
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: Last year, a student in my class, a freshman, with a background in Latin and Greek, was image-processing a palimpsest that we had photographed at a famous library in Rome.
target language text: Pagājušogad kāds pirmā kursa students ar zināšanām latīņu un grieķu valodā, multispektrāli apstrādāja palimpsestu, ko bijām nofotogrāfējuši slavenā Romas bibliotēkā.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: But as you study the inscriptions in the near total darkness, two of the eight graduate students accompanying you bump into the alter.
target language text: Taču, kamēr tu teju pilnīgā tumsā pēti rakstus, divi no astoņiem tavas ekspedīcijas studentiem nevilšus uzgrūžas altārim.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: You know for sure that the curse didn't get you, but you don't know which students can't be trusted, and because the possessed students may lie only occasionally, there is no guaranteed way to test them to determine which are cursed.
target language text: Tu droši zini, ka lāsts nav trāpījis tev, bet nezini, kuri no studentiem ir neuzticami, un, tā kā apsēstie studenti melo tikai reizēm, nav droša veida, kā pārliecināties, kuri no viņiem ir lāsta varā.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: We are already seeing car companies like Volvo designing cars differently with HoloLens; universities like Case Western redefining the way medical students learn; and my personal favorite, NASA is using HoloLens to let scientists explore planets holographically.
target language text: Mēs jau redzam tādus autoražotājus kā Volvo, kas ar HoloLens palīdzību izstrādā citādas automašīnas; tādas augstskolas kā Case Western, kas pārveido medicīnas studentu mācības; un mans mīļākais piemērs, NASA izmanto HoloLens, lai ļautu zinātniekiem pētīt planētas hologrāfiski.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: While showing in Berlin last year, a philosophy student asked me what prompted these recent killings.
target language text: Pagājušogad izstādē Berlīnē kāds filosofijas students man jautāja, kas veicinājis šo neseno vardarbību.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: We're going to be expanding this platform to the world, but already I've gotten thousands of emails from people all across the world -- professors, educators, students, and other archaeologists -- who are so excited to help participate.
target language text: Mēs izvērsīsim platformu visā pasaulē, bet jau tagad esmu saņēmusi tūkstošiem e-pastu no cilvēkiem visā pasaulē – profesoriem, izglītotājiem, studentiem un citiem arheologiem, – kas ar lielu prieku iesaistītos.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: It doesn't matter if you're a student or a scientist, whether you live in Honolulu or Hanoi, this is a community for everyone.
target language text: Nav svarīgi, vai esat students vai zinātnieks, vai dzīvojat Honolulū vai Hanojā, šī kopiena der ikkatram.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: So it was quite fun to do that, but it was kind of a hobby thing, and then we think we might -- so we've built a little pusher car to push the student pods, but we're going to try seeing how fast we can make the pusher go if it's not pushing something.
target language text: Tas bija visai jautri, bet tas bija tikai tāds vaļasprieks, un mēs nospriedām, ka varētu... mēs studentu vagoniņu stumšanai uzbūvējām mazu stūmēju, bet mēs izmēģināsim, cik ātri stūmējs spēj pārvietoties, ja tas neko nestumj.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: This is a graduate student. This is what he's doing to his thesis project -- very robust, if a graduate student does that to his thesis project.
target language text: Lūk, aspirantūras students. Un, lūk, ko viņš dara savai disertācijai, ļoti izturīgs, ja doktorants to dara savam disertācijas projektam.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: (Laughter) DP: This is just a cool shot, because this is students coming to school after class.
target language text: (Smiekli) DP: Šis ir vienkārši kolosāls kadrs, jo tajā redzams, kā studenti pēc nodarbības nāk uz skolu.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: And when I was teaching, I used to always ask the students, What's the definition of a good job?
target language text: Kad es biju skolotājs, es mēdzu vienmēr jautāt studentiem: "Kāda ir laba darba definīcija?"
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: We zoom in here by filtering the street to the middle, like this, and then I ask the students: Is this what your bedroom looks like?
target language text: Nofiltrēsim attēlus līdz ielas vidum. Tad es jautāju studentiem: vai tā izskatās jūsu guļamistaba?
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: In the classroom, we have arguments on some of the most fiercely held moral convictions that students have about big public questions.
target language text: Ar studentiem mēs diskutējam par dažām visspīvāk aizstāvētajām viņu morālajām pārliecībām, lielajiem sabiedrības jautājumiem.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: About 10 years ago, I took on the task to teach global development to Swedish undergraduate students.
target language text: Pirms aptuveni 10 gadiem es uzņēmos jaunajiem Zviedrijas bakalaura studentiem mācīt globālo attīstību.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: I thought, these students coming to us actually have the highest grade you can get in the Swedish college system, so I thought, maybe they know everything I'm going to teach them about.
target language text: Es domāju, ka nākošie studenti ir saņēmuši augstākās atzīmes Zviedrijas izglītības sistēmā, tāpēc iedomājos, ka varbūt viņi jau zina visu, ko grasījos viņiem mācīt.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: I have shown that Swedish top students know, statistically, significantly less about the world than the chimpanzees.
target language text: Esmu pierādījis, ka Zviedrijas labākie studenti statistiski par pasauli zina ievērojami mazāk nekā šimpanzes.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: I teach wonderfully intelligent students, and I assign 20 percent less work than I used to.
target language text: Es pasniedzu ļoti gudriem studentiem, un es uzdodu par 20 procentiem mazāk darba, nekā to darīju agrāk.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: Half of the students in each of these conditions are asked to make predictions about how much they're going to come to like the picture that they keep and the picture they leave behind.
target language text: Otrai daļai studentu pateicām tieši pretējo: „Izvēlieties, un, starp citu, ak vai, pēc 2 minūtēm to jau sūtīsim uz Angliju.
label: studenti/studentiem/students/studentu

source language text: Sometimes it's hard to tell the two apart.
target language text: Dažreiz ir grūti izšķirties.
label: dažreiz

source language text: But then sometimes I'm thinking, what are today's young generation up to?
target language text: Bet dažreiz es prātoju, ko domā šodienas jaunatne,
label: dažreiz

source language text: Sometimes you see them, they look, "Oh."
target language text: Dažreiz jūs viņus redzat. viņi izskatās, "Oho."
label: dažreiz

source language text: Every picture that you see there and thousands of others have been returned back to the person who lost it -- sometimes crossing oceans, sometimes going through language barriers.
target language text: Ikviena no redzamajām fotogrāfijām, kopā ar tūkstošiem citu, ir nokļuvušas atpakaļ pie cilvēkiem, kas tās pazaudējuši, dažreiz pat šķērsojot okeānus, dažreiz pat valodu barjeras.
label: dažreiz

source language text: Every picture that you see there and thousands of others have been returned back to the person who lost it -- sometimes crossing oceans, sometimes going through language barriers.
target language text: Ikviena no redzamajām fotogrāfijām, kopā ar tūkstošiem citu, ir nokļuvušas atpakaļ pie cilvēkiem, kas tās pazaudējuši, dažreiz pat šķērsojot okeānus, dažreiz pat valodu barjeras.
label: dažreiz

source language text: But I think sometimes they don't use them when they're designing buildings. Here's a case in point.
target language text: Taču, manuprāt, projektējot ēkas, viņi dažreiz tās neizmanto. Lūk, situācijas piemērs.
label: dažreiz

source language text: They kind of have this vault where they're stored in high-def, and George Lucas did all the sound effects. (Laughter) So sometimes, remembering them, it's like, it's not like any other kind of memories.
target language text: Tām ir tāda kā glabātuve, kur tās tiek saglabātas augstā izšķirtspējā un Džordžs Lūkass apstrādā visus skaņas efektus. (Smiekli) Tādēļ dažreiz, tās atceroties, šķiet, ka tās nelīdzinās nevienai citai atmiņai.
label: dažreiz

source language text: Sometimes we have to put cues around people to make it easier, and believe it or not, that can be studied scientifically.
target language text: Dažreiz cilvēkiem jāpasaka priekšā, kā to izdarīt vieglāk, un, ticiet vai nē, to arī var zinātniski pētīt.
label: dažreiz

source language text: If you look at the downside of globalization, it really does seem to be sometimes overwhelming.
target language text: Ja aplūkojam globalizācijas ēnas puses, dažreiz šķiet, ka to ir pārāk daudz.
label: dažreiz

source language text: Normal things about being a kid and realizing that sometimes, it was best to listen to my parents even when I didn't exactly understand why.
target language text: normālām bērnu lietām un apjausmu, ka dažreiz labāk paklausīt vecākiem, pat īsti nesapratot kāpēc.
label: dažreiz

source language text: Let me tell you, sometimes I dream of sheet rock and plywood.
target language text: Ziniet, dažreiz es sapņoju par akmens plāksnēm un finieri.
label: dažreiz

source language text: (Laughter) A lot of people tend to think that good design is just a matter of taste, and quite honestly, sometimes it is, actually, but sometimes it isn't, all right?
target language text: (Smiekli) Daudzi uzskata, ka labs dizains ir gaumes jautājums, un, pavisam atklāti, dažreiz tā arī ir. Bet dažreiz tā nav, ja?

source language text: (Laughter) A lot of people tend to think that good design is just a matter of taste, and quite honestly, sometimes it is, actually, but sometimes it isn't, all right?

source language text: Because the Golden Rule is difficult. I sometimes -- when I'm speaking to congregations about compassion, I sometimes see a mutinous expression crossing some of their faces because a lot of religious people prefer to be right, rather than compassionate. (Laughter) Now -- but that's not the whole story.
target language text: Jo Zelta likums ir grūts. Dažreiz, kad runāju konferencēs par līdzjūtību, dažreiz es redzu dumpīgas izteiksmes, kas šķērso dažas sejas, jo daudzi reliģiski cilvēki dod priekšroku tam, lai viņiem būtu taisnība, nekā būt līdzjūtīgiem. (Smiekli) Tagad - bet tas vēl nav viss.
label: dažreiz

source language text: Sometimes they agree.
target language text: Dažreiz viņi ir vienisprātis.
label: dažreiz

source language text: After all, we've engineered transgenic crops to be maximized for profit, crops that stand up to transport, crops that have a long shelf life, crops that taste sugary sweet but resist pests, sometimes at the expense of nutritional value.
target language text: Mēs taču ģenētiski veidojam kultūraugus, kas nodrošina lielāku pelņu, labāk iztur transportēšanu, ilgāk stāv svaigi veikalu plauktos, garšo saldi kā cukurs, bet nepiesaista kaitēkļus, dažreiz uz uzturvielu rēķina.

label: dažreiz

source language text: Extinction can come slowly, but sometimes it arrives fast.

label: dažreiz

source language text: And then what happens is, sometimes I absolutely can't draw or I can't compose at all, and then it's like there's too much on your mind.
target language text: Bet dažreiz ir tā, ka it nemaz nespēju pazīmēt vai nespēju pakomponēt. Un tad ir tā, ka man prātā ir pārāk daudz.
label: dažreiz

source language text: Sometimes you would think that maybe kids would enjoy it, but sometimes they get a little freaked out.
target language text: Varētu domāt, ka varbūt bērniem tas patiks, bet dažreiz viņi mazliet sabīstas.

source language text: Sometimes you can give somebody all the facts and figures, and they say, "I know what all the facts and details say, but it just doesn't feel right."

label: dažreiz

source language text: Sometimes it's easier to understand what people do, so we also do video snippets of everyday activities, such as washing hands, doing laundry, brushing teeth, and so on.

source language text: That one can measure roughness by a number, a number, 2.3, 1.2 and sometimes much more.

source language text: I use a lot of tricks, which means that sometimes I have to lie to you.
target language text: Es izmantoju daudz triku, kas nozīmē, ka reizēm man jums ir jāmelo.

source language text: But nothing, of course, in nature is totally perfect, so sometimes an error is made and a wrong letter is built in.

source language text: You sometimes had to send out for it, so the process could take weeks.

label: reizēm

source language text: And then sometimes you get this.
target language text: Un tad reizēm jūs saņemat šo.
label: reizēm

source language text: Sometimes instead of Control-Z, we actually have zero control.
target language text: Reizēm Control-Z vietā mums patiesībā ir nulle kontroles.
label: reizēm

source language text: Because of course, sometimes we do make decisions that have irrevocable and terrible consequences, either for our own or for other people's health and happiness and livelihoods, and in the very worst case scenario, even their lives.
target language text: jo, protams, reizēm mēs pieņemam lēmumus, kam ir negrozāmas un šausmīgas sekas vai nu mūsu pašu vai citu cilvēku veselībai, laimei un iztikai, un ļaunākajā gadījumā pat dzīvībai.
label: reizēm

source language text: Sometimes a good person would find it, sometimes a bad person would find it.
target language text: Reizēm to atrod labs cilvēks, reizēm slikts cilvēks.

source language text: Well sometimes we were suspended for a few hours, but we never, we never closed it again.
target language text: Reizēm mēs pātraucām uz pāris stundām, bet mēs nekad, nekad to neslēdzām.
label: reizēm

source language text: Sometimes the perspective is the illusion.
target language text: Reizēm ilūzija ir perspektīva.
label: reizēm

source language text: Yeah, so -- (Laughter) However, sometimes I need to find a different way to do something by making adjustments, and I want to put those things in the "can do" category.
target language text: Tā ka, jā... (Smiekli) Tomēr reizēm man jāatrod citāds veids, kā kaut ko izdarīt, proti, pielāgojoties, un šīs lietas es gribētu likt "varu izdarīt" sarakstā.
label: reizēm

source language text: They are raped, beaten up and sometimes killed with impunity.
target language text: Viņas tiek izvarotas, sistas un reizēm pat nogalinātas — nesodīti.
label: reizēm

source language text: Contrary to the way we sometimes talk about it, GDP was not handed down from God on tablets of stone. (Laughter) It's a measurement tool invented in the 20th century to address the challenges of the 20th century.
target language text: Pretēji tam, kā mēs reizēm par to runājam, IKP nav Dieva dots un akmens plāksnēs iegravēts. (Smiekli) Tā ir 20. gadsimtā izgudrota mērīšanas metodika, lai strādātu ar 20. gadsimta izaicinājumiem.
label: reizēm

source language text: And it's true, scientists sometimes throw terms out as linguistic place fillers -- dark energy or dark matter, something like that -- until we figure out what it is, we'll call it this.
target language text: Tā ir tiesa, zinātnieki reizēm svaidās ar jēdzieniem kā aizpildītājvārdiem — tumšā enerģija, tumšā matērija, kas tamlīdzīgs — kamēr nesapratīsim, kas tas ir, sauksim to šādi.
label: reizēm

source language text: Sometimes, I would say things to myself simply because I could.
target language text: Reizēm es pats sev kaut ko teicu vienkārši tāpēc, ka es to varēju.
label: reizēm

source language text: If there is one most difficult obstacle to my way of communicating, it is that sometimes I want to shout and other times simply to whisper a word of love or gratitude.
target language text: Vislielākais šķērslis manā saziņas veidā ir tas, ka reizēm es vēlos kliegt, bet citreiz vienkārši čukstēt mīlestības vai pateicības pilnus vārdus.
label: reizēm

source language text: If a grouper chases a fish into a crevice in the coral, it will sometimes go to where it knows a moray eel is sleeping and it will signal to the moray, "Follow me," and the moray will understand that signal.
target language text: Ja jūras asaris iemāna zivi koraļļu spraugā, tas reizēm dodas uz vietu, kur mitinās jūras zutis – tas dod zutim signālu „Seko man!”, un jūras zutis šo signālu saprot.
label: reizēm

source language text: It's also how renowned chemist August Kekule discovered the structure of the benzene molecule, and it's the reason that sometimes the best solution for a problem is to sleep on it.
target language text: Tieši tā plaši pazīstamais ķīmiķis Augusts Kekule atklāja benzola molekulas uzbūvi, un tas ir iemesls, kāpēc reizēm, risinot problēmas, rīts ir gudrāks par vakaru.
label: reizēm

source language text: More subtly, though, it can recover a second story behind every object, the story of how, when and by whom a text was created, and, sometimes, what the author was thinking at the time he wrote.
target language text: Vēl vairāk – ar to iespējams atgūt jebkura objekta sākotnējo stāstu, stāstu par to, kā, kad un kurš šo tekstu radījis, un reizēm – ko autors ir domājis rakstīšanas laikā.
label: reizēm

source language text: My sister would help sometimes.
target language text: Mana māsa reizēm palīdzēja.
label: reizēm

source language text: These are little things, but sometimes it's the little things that sting the most.

source language text: Sometimes I'll be alone, sometimes with other people, sometimes in a restaurant, sometimes at home, but the rule that I've adopted is: I will never use my phone at the table.
target language text: Reizēm es ēdīšu viens, reizēm kopā ar citiem, reizēm restorānā, reizēm mājās, taču apņēmies ievērot šādu likumu: es nekad nelietošu telefonu pie galda.
label: reizēm

source language text: Sometimes I'll be alone, sometimes with other people, sometimes in a restaurant, sometimes at home, but the rule that I've adopted is: I will never use my phone at the table.
target language text: Reizēm es ēdīšu viens, reizēm kopā ar citiem, reizēm restorānā, reizēm mājās, taču apņēmies ievērot šādu likumu: es nekad nelietošu telefonu pie galda.
label: reizēm

source language text: But tonight, I've got some notes here so that if I begin to forget, which I do sometimes, I've got something I can turn to.
